title: Rotational KE - small cylinder on thin disc

content.prompt: A thin, uniform, circular disk of mass m0 and radius 2r0 rotates at a constant angular velocity about a vertical axis through its center, as shown in the figure. On the top of the disk is a small dense cylinder of the same mass m0. The cylinder moves in a circle of radius r0 without slipping as the disk rotates. If the diameter of the cylinder is much smaller than r0, which of the following statements is true?

choices.label: The thin disk has more kinetic energy than the small cylinder.
The small cylinder has more kinetic energy than the thin disk.
The kinetic energy is the same for the two objects.
The kinetic energies of the objects cannot be compared, since the thin disk has rotational kinetic energy and the small cylinder has translational kinetic energy.

unit.text: 6: Energy and Momentum of Rotating Systems

skill.text: 3.B: Apply an appropriate law, definition, theoretical relationship, or model to make a claim.
